bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding abandonment of motor vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding abandonment of motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-30-12 be amended to read as follows: 32-30-12. If any vehicle is left unattended on any public road, highway, or h ighway right-of-way of this state, for a longer period than twenty-four hours without notifying the sheriff, highway patrol office of the county, a peace officer of the municipality, or the appropriate municipal officials where the vehicle is parked it is an abandoned vehicle and is subject to the provisions of § § 32-30-13 to 32-30-18 § § 32-30-12.2 to 32-30-18.1 , inclusive, or to chapter 32-36 for the purposes of being titled by a removal agency. Section 2. That chapter 32-30 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If any vehicle is left unattended on private property without the permission of the landowner or tenant, it is an abandoned vehicle and is subject to the provisions of § § 32-30-12.2 to 32-30- 18.1, inclusive, or to chapter 32-36 for the purposes of being titled by a removal agency. Section 3. That § 32-30-12.2 be amended to read as follows: 32-30-12.2. No person shall intentionally may abandon a motor vehicle on any public road, highway or , right-of-way , or private property without the permission of the landowner or tenant . A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Any person convicted of abandoning a motor vehicle shall be ordered to pay a fine of five hundred dollars. The court shall suspend the fine if the person pays for the towing and storage expenses. It is a rebuttable presumption that the owner of the vehicle is the person who abandoned it. Section 4. That § 32-30-13 be amended to read as follows: 32-30-13. Whenever any When any landowner or tenant, agent of the South Dakota Highway Patrol, sheriff, or peace officer of this state finds an abandoned vehicle such landowner or tenant, agent, sheriff, or peace officer is hereby authorized to may provide for the removal of such vehicle to the nearest garage or place of safety. Section 5. That § 32-30-18.1 be amended to read as follows: 32-30-18.1. Any The owner of a motor vehicle who intentionally abandons a motor vehicle abandoned on any public road, highway or right-of-way , or private property without the permission of the landowner or tenant is civilly liable to the towing company for the expense of towing the motor vehicle. The owner is also civilly liable for any storage expense pursuant to § 32-36-8.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
